experiences.title: Student
experiences.details: Thinkful offers a 6 month bootcamp in front-end and back-end web development.  They set their students up with a 1 on 1 mentor 3 times a week, a robust and friendly slack community, and plenty of workshops, Q&As, and side preparation.  Languages learned: html/css, javascript, node.js, react.js.

projects.name: Politikos
projects.detail: This is a full stack project using a React.js front-end and a Node.js backend. The Google Civics API (https://developers.google.com/civic-information) allows me to show clients their current political representatives and collaborate using facebook-style posts and comments. Passwords are hashed using bcrypt, and user data is currently stored in MongoDB.

projects.name: WhetherYouLike
projects.detail: WhetherYouLike is an android mobile application prototype, where the user can customize a screen with weather, date/time, and location information. Elements are customizeable, draggable, and there is even an option for webcam.  This project will eventually be converted to either React Native, or Kotlin.

projects.name: War, Card Game App
projects.detail: Building this application was an exercise in AJAX, Jquery, javascript, and CSS animation styling. It uses the deck of cards API (deckofcardsapi.com) and the card images and positions on the board are all kept track of by the API itself.  This was a big exercise in using event listeners and controling the flow of asyncronous operations, as well as responsive design.

projects.name: Movie Quotes Quiz
projects.detail: This was my first capstone project at the Thinkful bootcamp.  It demonstrates my ability to effectively use and manipulate state within a single application.
